text: John Brian Patrick Quinn (January 29, 1943 â€“ November 23, 2014) was a Canadian ice hockey player, head coach, and executive. He was known by the nickname "The Big Irishman". He coached for the National Hockey League's Philadelphia Flyers, Los Angeles Kings, Vancouver Canucks, Toronto Maple Leafs, and Edmonton Oilers. Quinn reached in the Stanley Cup Finals twice, with the Flyers in 1980 and the Canucks in 1994. Internationally, Quinn coached Team Canada to gold medals at the 2002 Winter Olympics, 2008 IIHF World U18 Championships and 2009 World Junior Championship, as well as World Cup championship in 2004. His cousin was wrestler John Quinn. Quinn died at the Vancouver General Hospital in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada on November 23, 2014 after a long illness, aged 71. ==References== ==Other websites== *CBS Sportsline Category:1943 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Atlanta Flames players Category:Canadian ice hockey coaches Category:Canadian ice hockey defencemen Category:Central Professional Hockey League players Category:Disease-related deaths in British Columbia Category:Ice hockey people from Ontario Category:Jack Adams Award winners Category:Memorial Cup winners Category:Sportspeople from Hamilton, Ontario Category:Toronto Maple Leafs players Category:Vancouver Canucks players
title: Pat Quinn (ice hockey)
